fields.description:
{code:java}
  
   Nils@Nils-NB-MSI MINGW32 /d/xampp/htdocs/Marlin (my-skr-mini-e3)                
$ git push                                                                      
Enumerating objects: 19, done.                                                  
Counting objects: 100% (19/19), done.                                           
Delta compression using up to 8 threads                                         
Compressing objects: 100% (9/9), done.                                          
Writing objects: 100% (9/9), 903 bytes | 451.00 KiB/s, done.

 ! [remote rejected]     my-skr-mini-e3 -> my-skr-mini-e3 (refusing to allow an 
OAuth App to create or update workflow `.github/workflows/bump-date.yml` without
 `workflow` scope)

{code}


Revoked and reloggedin already, st is not asking for workflow scope and i cannot add it manuel.

st win v3.2.6 not in list, if u dont update the list dont make it a required field!

How to push my fork now?
fields.summary: Missing OAUTH scope

fields.description:
*Precondition:*

*1)* open application "Укрзалізниця"

*2)* select any menu item

*3)* rotate the screen horizontally

*Expected results:* ** if the application logic should show the user's current tickets, then you need to go to the "Мои билеты" menu, where the list of available tickets for the user is located

*Actual results:* at horizontal position of the screen produces text: "У вас нет актуальных билетов" "Поверните ваше устройство вертикально для работы с приложением"**
fields.summary: incorrect recording when rotating the screen
"Укрзалізниця" application: language issue

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce: 
 # Open Укрзалізниця mobile application on the device
 # On "Напрямок" tab open "Дата"
 # Try to choose "листопад".

Expected result: there is no option for a previous month OR ability freely change a month for a valid one

Actual result: all months except for "грудень" disappeared. There is only option to change the date and only after this - a month.
fields.summary: Укрзалізниця mobile application: ability to choose a month on 'Напрямок' tab disappears when trying to chose previous mounth

fields.description:
In version 3.3.6, the UI is not updating unless a manual refresh (F5) is performed. This is working fine with 3.2.6 installed. I have tested the auto refresh on multiple computers and it is not working.

While pressing F5 is a workaround, it is very annoying to require a keypress every time the window comes in to focus.

3.3 is not an option for the 'affect versions' selection
fields.summary: Automatic Refresh on File Change is Not Working

fields.description: Wow this doesn't work!
fields.summary: Upload to confluence is broken!

fields.description: I want to make a custom action in the branch list to "fetch and checkout" branch (instead of having to fetch, wait and then checkout..).
fields.summary: Selected branch as variable in Custom Actions

fields.description:
Randomly Sourcetree dialogs won't accept Enter to submit those dialogs. For example, start Sourcetree, press Ctrl+Shift+F to open Fetch dialog and press Enter. Most of the time, but not always, this dialog won't get focus and so Enter will do nothing. 

This is an old bug, seen at least for a few months.
fields.summary: Focus is lost on dialog buttons

fields.description: Worked last week.  Started with version 3.2.1 this morning (with reported problem).  Noted newer version (3.3.6) and installed in hope of resolution.  Same problem.  Upon pull or fetch, process shows activity but never completes (retried multiple times; have allowed to run over an hour before stopping).
fields.summary: SourceTree hangs on pull or fetch

fields.description:
I was able to reproduce this and submitted bug reports under the email address [jason.poggioli@nextvote.com|mailto:jason.poggioli@nextvote.com]

Sourcetree was crashing on commit to a new repo without any error dialog explanation.

Using a different git client I discovered my git username and email address were defaulted to username@machinename and now a valid email address. Once I changed this, Sourcetree stopped crashing when committing files.

*(Note:* This was in version 3.2.6, but that's not yet a choice below)
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes if local git settings are invalid

fields.description:
I updated Sourcetree to 3.3.6  (which is not available in the Versions list in Jira...)

Sourcetree -> Tools -> Options -> Git -> Git Version -> Update Embedded

It downloads Git 2.21.0, rather than the newest release:  [https://github.com/git-for-windows/git/releases/tag/v2.24.1.windows.2]

There are some critical security vulnerabilities that have been fixed recently in Git, so I'm told that it is important to update Git.
fields.summary: Update Embedded is not downloading the latest Git For Windows release

fields.description:
*steps to reproduce:*

1.Download the application on the device and take it off

2.flip the device

*Expected result:*expect a bug
fields.summary: download the application "UKRzalіznitsya"

fields.description:
* Precondition: there is at least one available seat on any train in the future (within 45 days from current date).

 ## Open app "Железнодорожные билеты".
 ## Go to page Search.
 ## Enter in "Route" fields: destination from and to.
 ## Enter in "Departure" field: date.
 ## Enter in "Time from" field: time.
 ## Press "Find trains" button.
 ## Select any Route.
 ## On page Train select traine price.
 ## Select any available seat on Seats selection page.
 ## Press "Show 1 seat"  button on show-up menu.
 ## Press "Order" button on the next show-up menu.
 ## Select ticket "Full", enter your personal data and press "To Cart" on Order ticket page.
 ## Proceed to Cart page and press Pay button
 ## In the field "Sign or enter your e-mail to recieve tickets" enter  valid e-mail and select "I agree", press "Continue" button.
 ## Proceed to Payment method page.
 ## Press Cancel button.
Expected result: The selected ticket or tickets are available in Cart page.

Actual result: Empty Cart in Cart page when pressed button Cancel on Payment method page.
fields.summary: App for Ios "Железнодорожные билеты": Empty Cart after canceling payment

fields.description:

 # Proceed to Payment method page.

Expected result: The selected ticket or tickets are available in Cart page.

Actual result: Empty Cart in Cart page when pressed button Cancel on Payment method page.
fields.summary: App for Ios "Железнодорожные билеты": Empty Cart after canceling payment

fields.description:
At the first step installer offers to log in with Bitbucket Server or Bitbucket account.

I logged with my Bitbucket account then see next picture in browser
h1. Confirm access to your account

*Sourcetree for Windows* is requesting access to the following:
 * Read and modify your account information
 * Read and modify your repositories' issues
 * Read and modify your workspace's project settings, and read and transfer repositories within your workspace's projects
 * Read and modify your repositories and their pull requests
 * Administer your repositories
 * Read and modify your snippets
 * Read and modify your team membership information
 * Read and modify your repositories' webhooks
 * Read and modify your repositories' wikis

By installing the App you agree to the [privacy policy|https://www.atlassian.com/legal/privacy-policy] and [terms of use|https://www.atlassian.com/legal/cloud-terms-of-service] provided by Sourcetree for Windows.

 

When i click on "Grant access" button, page does redirect to [https://localhost:34106/?state=authenticated&code=cDBHk9NSSDMPJRLu5J] and browser says 
h1. This site can’t provide a secure connection

*localhost* sent an invalid response.

 

Installer just waiting for login to finish... and nothing happens afterwards.

 

[SourceTreeSetup-3.2.6.exe|https://product-downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/ga/SourceTreeSetup-3.2.6.exe] is my installer. Windows 10 Pro N.
fields.summary: Issue while install process, logging with Bitbucket account

fields.description:
*SourceTree for Windows, version 3.3.4* (Affected Version field below doesn't have 3.3.4)

Within the last week, I started getting an AskPass dialog intermittently popping up over other apps. SourceTree isn't being used at the time and is usually minimized. Often it happens in bunches; 3-5 dialogs popping up one after the other. Then some time passes, and another bunch comes. It's incredibly annoying to have a background app interrupting work being done in a foreground app.

!image-2019-12-12-10-56-39-659.png!
fields.summary: AskPass error dialog (0xc0000142) keeps popping up over other apps

fields.description:
When i try to close a created feature, in the "Finish feature" dialog the feature name initially is loaded with the actual name of the feature but when it finishes the loading (and spinner in the right side of the drop-down disappear) this field goes blank and if i open the drop-down is blank too and due to this behavior the Ok button will be disabled.

PD: If i try to finish the feature while the Ok button is enabled, the feature closes correctly.

PD2:  I run this on windows in the sourcetree version 3.3.4, that version is not in this form field "Addecs Versions" so i choosed the last version available in that list (3.2.2)
fields.summary: Feature can't be closed from git-flow

fields.description:
I use a Lenovo laptop connected to external monitors through the display adaptor Intel(R) UHD Graphics 620. This runs Windows 10 64 bit. Following an update to this adaptor driver SourceTree does not open any longer.

I have uninstalled SourceTree and re-installed, trying different version but the install only creates the shortcut and an entry in the Add / Remove programs.

When I disable the display adaptor (so I can only use the laptop screen), SourceTree will install and will run as expected. 

As soon as I re-enable the display adaptor, SourceTree will not start. I have tried many different things (run as Admin, roll back recent windows updates) but I am unable to rollback the driver causing the problem (or install a basic standard driver).
fields.summary: SourceTree does not open
Source Tree External difference comparison, no response。
How to set the font and font size of the submitted text box? Chinese fonts look uncomfortable

fields.description:
I have been running the app for several days now and after I'm done with my work I usually hibernate the machine.

 

After several days writing commit messages was really "sticky" with letters appearing half a second after they are typed. Also, branching and checking out is a bit stickier than usual.

I tried restarting the app, it showed immediate improvement but using it for a day came to the same outcome as described above.

I have just sent a crash-report about 6 minutes ago so you might be able to connect it to this case.

 

The version is actually 3.2.6. and not 3.2.2 as it says in "Affects version"

!image-2019-12-10-14-15-27-994.png!
fields.summary: Application slows down and eventually crashes when not shut down for a couple of days

fields.description:
Firstly, I made custom action with one parameter is set. (In the parameter field, “$FILE” was used.)  And right click on one file of one commit and choose custom action ,  the custom action I made earlier was  displayed as usual.

Secondly, I made custom action with multiple parameters are set .(In the parameter field, “$SHA  $FILE” was used.)  And right click on one file of one commit and choose custom action , but  the custom action I made earlier was NOT displayed.

(For comparison, I did the same things with Sourcetree For Mac and both showed up. So, this is only For Windows bug.)
fields.summary: Custom Actions is not working when set parameter multiple

fields.description:
Sourcetree version 3.3.4

Git embedded 2.21.0

Windows 10 Pro 10.0.18363

If Use Git Bash option is selected, Terminal button does not work, if unselected, a cmd prompt window is opened correctly. Seems to be a pathing issue with the terminal button and git bash executable
fields.summary: Terminal button (and menu) fails to open Git Bash

fields.description:
The Jira webpage shows the big stuff on the left and gradually drill down to details towards the right, i.e. Kanban board, Releases, Reports etc, followed by "Open issues", followed by conversations of the issues.

Why doesn't Sourcetree follow this same concept? Instead the Repository is on the right. Please move it to the left or at least make it configurable. Also, please allow SORTing of the repositories. It is a herculean task change the repository order right now with 3.2.6.

*ALL* repos have to be move out of a folder and then back 1 by 1 in the order to be sorted... gosh.....
fields.summary: Move Repository bar to left

fields.description:
SourceTree version : 3.3.4.3796
When I configure a Commit text Link and close SourceTree I can see the correct configuration in \.git\sourcetreeconfig.json.
If I reopen SourceTree I see that the configured Commit text Link has been deleted.
(just after reopening of SourceTree the file \.git\sourcetreeconfig.json is already overwritten with the deleted configuration)



remark: because the field 'Affects Version/s' is required but my version is not available I added an existing but wrong version in this field. My version : 3.3.4.3796
fields.summary: Commit text Links are reset when opening SourceTree

fields.description:
It appears that whenever I click a link in BitBucket to do something in SourceTree, whether checking out a branch of cloning a repository, the URL Action window in SourceTree will cause SourceTree to crash. This happens whatever button I press in the URL Action dialog, including Cancel.

This happens in SourceTree 3.3.4, although that version isn't available in the "Affects Version" below, so I just picked the latest version.
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes when using URL Action

fields.description:
I've found on a semi-regular basis that SourceTree has converted my remote on a repository to Generic Host from Bitbucket. I can usually tell initially because the "Remote" icon in the top right has a red ! on it. When it is in this state, I also cannot create a pull request from a branch.

 

This seemed to start happening after the update to 3.3.4 (which isn't included in the Versions list below, so I just picked the latest version)
fields.summary: SourceTree often converts repository remote from BitBucket to Generic

fields.description:
after a day or so sourctree forgets the credentials to bitbucket, and fails to push or fetch.

If I open the Options -> Authentication -> <my Bitbucket account> ->edit

the authentication check starts,and says ok. after that I can push and fetch again (without editing something)

 

(the sourcetree version is  3.3.4, but i couldn't select that in th affects versions field
fields.summary: SourceTree forgets my bitbucket authentication

fields.description: Sourcetree version 3.2.6 Install and Registration windows does not advance to next screen after installing it on a Windows 10 desktop and trying to open the Sourcetree software.  The "Next" button stays disabled even after I log into my Atlassian  cloud account and "Grant access". I have tried various things i.e. changing browser from IE to Chrome and Firefox. Also registering a new account but nothing works.
fields.summary: Sourcetree Install and Registration windows does not advance to next screen

fields.description:
Currently my sourcetree version is 3.1.3.3158 and i am unable to push to my organisation github repo. 

I keep getting the authentication failed message. i am currently using Gitkarken to get around this but i dont know whats wrong with sourcetree i have setup the two factor authentication correctly and have re done it so many times.

!image-2019-12-05-10-25-17-450.png!

fields.description:
As per the title, our corporate group policy requires a valid certificate, and therefore SourceTree stopped working when the certificate expired on 27/11/2019

I have downloaded the installer again to see if it has been updated since but it appears it has not.

{noformat}
The Remote branch '' (Local branch = 'mybranch') is invalid. Ref names must follow git ref-format rules: 
https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/git-check-ref-format.html
Completed with errors, see above.{noformat}

See: [demo (GIF)|https://drive.google.com/open?id=1bE3cCanxoFl8foyRBp-AvoccIRBtF8yo]

The remote button has an "!" icon on it, and I cannot push or pull until I reset the account to the proper type.

fields.description:
Hello,

The UI isn't showing changes I do. for example when I press stage all or stage selected it doesn't update and doesn't update the commit button. my other colleagues work fine that arent in dark mode. I have to constantly close and reopen the program so that the commit button is activated. this is very annoying.

I'm on version 3.3.6.3829, I've put the wrong version in the ticket because there isn't one open for it. !image-2019-12-02-12-09-39-828.png!

fields.description:
SourceTree v3.2.6 is missing a code signing timestamp. Certificate has expired on 27.11.2019.

!image-2019-12-02-12-36-04-845.png!

Application cannot be whitelisted in AppLocker via publisher certificate.
fields.summary: Code signing timestamp is missing from SourceTree v3.2.6

fields.description:
When typing a commit message, Sourcetree stutters and my processor load goes to 25%. I use a dual core with hyperthreading, so I guess that means 100% load on one core. It drops to zero after you stop typing.

It's been happing for a while now with multiple versions. On Windows 7, now Sourcetree 3.2.6.3544.
fields.summary: 100% load on one core when typing commit message

fields.description:
Hello,

i try to install sourcetree on my computer with windows10 but i've got this error:

!image-2019-11-28-19-02-25-104.png!
fields.summary: SourceTree installation

fields.description:
When pressing the push button branches to push is empty.
!image-2019-11-28-16-35-13-918.png|width=575,height=215!

Problem occurs when you using a config file under .git folder with the argument.
{code:java}
push = refs/heads/*:refs/for/*{code}
Entire config filer:
{code:java}
[core] 
  bare = false 
  repositoryformatversion = 0 
  filemode = false 
  symlinks = false 
  ignorecase = true 
  logallrefupdates = true 
  autocrlf = true
[remote "origin"] 
  url = http://ctgit:8080/gerrit/wsp/utils 
  fetch = +refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/origin/* 
  push = refs/heads/*:refs/for/*
[branch "master"] 
  remote = origin 
  merge = refs/heads/master{code}
fields.summary: Push dialog empty

fields.description:
Issue happened when you open repo with clone button , 

if password changes after that sourcetree fail to push or to connect to remote repo anymore and noway to change the saved password , i had to create batch file that open sourcetree config files and remove the password manually.
fields.summary: Provide Re-Authentication window when push return access denied.

fields.description:
Branches list does allow only one branch to be selected. It doesn't support selection with Shift or Ctrl. That makes branches deletion process almost impossible when you have to delete 20-30 branches at once. I use SourceTree all the time, but run SmartGit when I clean up repository only because SmartGit can select multiple branches.

Menu "Branches -> Delete" supposed to help in multiple branches deletion, but it doesn't allow to select multiple branches at once, doesn't support Shift and/or Space to check branches checkboxes, so using SmartGit is still faster than this.
fields.summary: Cannot select multiple branches
Allow for custom theme configuration for dark mode for Sourcetree Windows
Crash when attempting to initiate Gitlab-EE pull request

fields.description:
Set filter for "Show Remote Branches" off, or branch filter to "Current Branch".

Then, try to "Jump to" a specific revision that is not visible due to the filter. SourceTree starts loading commits and will never end the load.

It should yield an error message telling us that the commit is not visible due to filters instead.
fields.summary: Endless "Loading x commits to reach commit y" when filter is on

fields.description:
Auto Refresh doesn't work when files are changing, removed or added.

Git Version: 2.24.0.2 for Windows

Sourcetree (Windows 10) was updated from integrated updater.

!image-2019-11-26-22-14-06-766.png|width=528,height=468!

!image-2019-11-26-22-13-12-173.png|width=532,height=331!

!image-2019-11-26-22-09-37-435.png|width=532,height=774!!image-2019-11-26-22-09-37-389.png|width=531,height=487!
fields.summary: Auto Refresh doesn't work when files are changing (Version:  3.3.6.3829)

fields.description:
SourceTree may not allow the user to open a local repository, and will instead select another tab that is already open. This happens when the repo is also a submodule of another repo and the submodule is already open in another tab. Steps to reproduce:

Git repository 'A' cloned to C:\GitRoot\A

Git repository 'B' cloned to C:\Git\Root\B

Repo B is also a submodule of A, so a copy also exists in C:\GitRoot\A\B.

Open repo A.

In Submodules section of repo A, double-click repo B to open it in another tab.

Click '+' to the right of tabs. In Local Repositories double-click repository B (i.e. the clone in C:\GitRoot\B).

A new tab should open for repo B, however the repo B (submodule) tab is selected instead.

This is a fairly new bug in SourceTree that affects version {color:#ffbdad}+*3.3.4*+{color:#172b4d} (which is not available in the Jira Affected Version/s field).{color}{color}
fields.summary: Cannot open local repo when repo is a submodule open in another tab

fields.description:
In commits history, files list window after file selecting and invoking context menu item "Copy Path To Clipboard" app hangs on 3~5 seconds.

 

If copy line of code from file diff view and paste it in another app "SourceTree" hangs on ~10 seconds.
fields.summary: After click menu item "Copy Path To Clipboard" app hangs on several seconds

fields.description:
When set defoult user in settings autondification, then text will shifted
Source Tree version 3.3.2-beta-3742
fields.summary: trusted_tester , Bug UI

fields.description:
Setting up commit links (for git repo) for Jira works OK - but the settings are lost when closing and restarting the app.

Using  3.3.0-beta-3678
fields.summary: Commit text links are lost when closing and reopening app

fields.description:
When selecting the option to "Checkout in SourceTree" from a BitBucket Server, the dialog prompting where to checkout and which bookmarked repository, no existing or matching repository is available. Additionally, when the dialog closes (clicking {{Cancel}} or cloning to a new directory) the application crashes.

The issue may be related to SRCTREEWIN-12484, since that issue reports losing information and configuration relating to the properties of the remote repository.

Actual version ios {{3.3.4}}, however, the latest version available in the "Affects version/s" list 3.2.2.
fields.summary: Application Crash When Using "Checkout In SourceTree" from BitBucket Server

fields.description:
"something went wrong" error occurs while creating tag in Mercurial repository and if default branch has *Branch permissions* set with *None* having *Write access*.

We do get 500 console error and "something went wrong" error in UI.

*Expected behavior*:

We should get error message something like "You are not allowed to write to this branch - check branch permissions"

*Workaround:* 

As a workaround of this issue user can add himself in the *Branch permissions*->*Write access* for default branch. Once the user is added in the Write access for default branch, user will be able to create tags.
fields.summary: "something went wrong" error while creating tag in Mercurial repository

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the apllication
 # Click on the field "Звідки" or "Куди"
 # After separate page for direction selection is opened, without entering info in field click on confirmation button on keybord (in current example button Далее)
 # After text cursor diasppers from field, type any symbols or press line break button

*Expected result:* text cursor does not dissappears, field stays active untill user types in info 

*Actual result:* text cursor dissappears and on screen appears black rectangle in in which typed characters or line breaks appear but that are not inserted into the search field

*Tested on:*
 Android 7.0

*Device:*
 Huawei Nova

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/get-started-with-sourcetree/clone-a-remote-repository-847359098.html?_ga=2.95715484.1086806822.1573722716-2057597182.1569394259]

tells me that I can browse all repositories on our Bitbucket server from within Sourcetree but it is empty.   

!https://bitbucket.org/repo/BgzgjpR/images/656881506-image.png!

!https://bitbucket.org/repo/BgzgjpR/images/2119998866-image.png!

Ironically it tells me to set up a remote account, what I did, but it does show any repository
fields.summary: SourceTree not showing Bitbucket repositories

fields.description: I originally could not create a branch due to errors in the sourcetree. At first I thought i made a mistake, After checking out .gitignore and readme.md, I found that sourcetree was not consistent when enabling me to create a branch. After throughly testing by reinstalling sourcetree and removing readme.md and .git folder, it has been confirmed that sourcetree is not totally stable or consistent. There's no guarantee that I'm able to create a branch or it can suddenly work even when not all commands in git was used. Please reply so I can show you the error message that can no longer be reproduced.
fields.summary: Bug found in sourcetree 3.2.6

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

1. Open Mobile application "Railway tickets"

2. Go to "Return ticket"

*Expected result:*

There is the possibility to "go back" to the main menu

*Actual result:*

An option to "go back" to main menu doesn't exist 

*Environment:*

iOS version 13.2.3 IPhone 7
fields.summary: Lack "go back" button in "Return tickets" form

fields.description:
In previous versions, if I selected "Current Branch" then closed/re-opened Sourcetree, it would still have "Current Branch" selected. In one of the recent updates, that feature broke and now "All Branches" is selected by default every time Sourcetree launches.

 

I am using Version 3.3.4, but it doesn't appear in the "Affects Version/s" selection so I just picked the highest number I could find.
fields.summary: All Branches / Current Branch Dropdown doesn't remember choice

fields.description:
After I updated SourceTree to version 3.3.4, I got some issues as below:
 * I always set repository address for Github site to pull request to remote origin. Although the repository address don't any changes. (I attached related photos in this bug report)
 * On SourceTree window, "Remote" icon always show a red exclamation mark. When I click on it, it's still working okay.
 * When I checkout from "origin/master" branch with "Local branch should track remote branch" option is checked. Then, I can't push to origin with same branch name. Because don't have any item in "branches to pushes" for it.
fields.summary: Always update repository github address when launch sourcetree

fields.description:
Steps to repoduce

1) [http://nibulon.com/data/zakupivlya-silgospprodukcii/kalkulyator-znizhok.html]

2)Выбрать зерновую культуру " Пшеница 2 класс"

3) Выбрать базу поставки "Сватівська"

4) Показатель влажности вписываем значение <14%

5) Показатель загрязнения =<20%

6)Нажимаем "Рассчитать"

Результат 0

Фактическое значение отрицательный процент скидки

Поправка : Вписываемый процент влажности зерновой культуры"Пшеница 2 класс"

для получения скидки должен быть >=14%. В противоположном действии скидка станет доплатой.
fields.summary: Калькулятор скидки: Не верный рассчет

fields.description:
Действия:
 # Заходим на сайт: [http://nibulon.com/data/zakupivlya-silgospprodukcii/kalkulyator-znizhok.html]
 # Выбираем зерновую культуру "Пшеница 2 класс"
 # Выбираем базу поставки. Не имеет значения.
 # В графе показателя процента  влажности вписываем значение <14%
 # В графе показателя процента загрязнения вписываем значение  =<20%
 # Нажимаем кнопку "Рассчитать"

Ожидаемый результат: 0%

Фактический: Отрицательный процент скидки

Поправка: Вписываемый процент фактической влажности зерновой культуры "Пшеница 2 класс", для получения скидки - должен быть >=14%. В противном случае, скидка становится доплатой. Что противоречит бизнес-логике.
fields.summary: Калькулятор скидки: не правильный расчет.

Taskbar not accessible when SourceTree is full screen.


*Note:* Taskbar is set to hide in desktop mode.

*Expected Result:* Hovering the mouse below the screen should allow the user to access the taskbar.

fields.description:
After update to Sourcetree 3.3.4.3796 all repositories display error on remote button.

Adding Host Root URL works until restart.

Restart deletes everything.
fields.summary: Remote (Host Root URL) is not being saved and displays error

fields.description:
Hi, the text cursor disappears in commit message text area, see the image.

I'm using the 3.2.6 version but it isn't listed in "Affects Version" field.

!image-2019-11-14-12-39-43-147.png!
fields.summary: Text cursor disappears in commit message text area

fields.description:
This is regardless if I am Pushing to Bitbucket or TFS, same issue.

The problem is that with a new Branch the Remote branch by default is empty '' and to get it filled, we can not use the Dropdown Menu as it is not there in the list of Remote branches.

So, the typical scenario is If we create a new Branch, then try to Push, the current (new) branch is by default Checked (and even if we check it ourselves) in the Push window, if we click Push at this stage we get an error:
{code:java}
The Remote branch '' (Local branch = 'E1029') is invalid. Ref names must follow git ref-format rules: 
https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/git-check-ref-format.html
Completed with errors, see above.{code}
Now by uncheck/check again the (new) Branch in the Push Window, the Remote branch name get  filled with the same Name of the new branch and then Push will go through.

This peculiar behavior was not there a couple of versions back (I think it was Ok at 3.2.5 ..
fields.summary: ver 3.3.4  Can not Push new Branch unless I check/uncheck/check again the Branch to get the Remote name filled
WTF ??? Not display branches

fields.summary: test

Same flow when tried in Chrome, it successfully logs in.

Problem is, in SourceTree also, it uses same IE-11 and we are not able to login to Sourcetree.

fields.description:
I have latest Source tree 3.1.3 on windows 10 , when I try to add our Azure DevOps organization as Remote account I am getting following "Authentication failed Object reference not set to an instance of an object"error . I have used Username and PAT which has needed scope and access. Appreciate any help on how to resolve this??? Following are the steps I performed after creating PAT in Azure DevOps with FULL ACCESS by following instructions in this URL [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/accounts/use-personal-access-tokens-to-authenticate?view=azure-devops]

 

+STEP:1+

Click on Remote Tab -> Add an account

!file:///C:/Users/10151443/AppData/Local/Temp/1/msohtmlclip1/02/clip_image001.png|width=1106,height=674!

 

+STEP:2+

Enter or select following values

Hosting Service: Azure DevOps

Host URL: [https://organizationname.visualstudio.com/]

Preferred Protocol: HTTPS

Authentication: Personal Access Token

Then clicked on "Refresh Personal Access Token" button

 

  !file:///C:/Users/10151443/AppData/Local/Temp/1/msohtmlclip1/02/clip_image001.png|width=867,height=674!

+STEP:3+

Entered username and PAT as password

!file:///C:/Users/10151443/AppData/Local/Temp/1/msohtmlclip1/02/clip_image001.png|width=915,height=667!

 

Which returned following Authentication failed error

 

  !file:///C:/Users/10151443/AppData/Local/Temp/1/msohtmlclip1/02/clip_image001.png|width=868,height=783!

Please help in resolving this issue.
fields.summary: Unable to add Azure DevOps Remote Account using SourceTree 3.1.3

fields.description:
It takes 0.5-1 hour to use all 32gigs of ram.

In task manager "Git-Credential-Manager-for-Windows" is the culprit but it happens only when SourceTree is opened.

version 3.3.4

fields.description:
Hi everyone,

After I initialize my repo with GitFlow, I don't find the "Start bugfix" in the GitFlow window. 

!image-2019-11-11-13-46-31-799.png!

Now I'm using the terminal with the command "git flow bugfix start ....."
fields.summary: Git Flow - "Start bugfix" feature

fields.description:
I work with several repositories on Bitbucket Server, and I checked them out with my employee account.

Everything works fine, but every time I restart Sourcetree I get an exclamation mark on the Remote button:

!image-2019-11-11-11-34-59-099.png!

If I look into the repository settings I can see it has been switched to the Generic Account, rather than my remote account.

If I select my account the exclamation mark disappear, but at the next restart I get the same issue.

 

(The version affected is 3.3.4, but I can't find it in the version list, so I selected the latest available)
fields.summary: Remote account reset at every restart

fields.description:
Since upgrading to *Sourcetree 3.3.4*, we are getting an error message when trying to create a pull request.

!image-2019-11-08-09-06-33-332.png!

Also, the "Remote" button, located on the top right of the Sourcetree window, is now showing a red exclamation mark. When this button is clicked another error message is shown "Unable to open your web browser to <remote URL>, do you have a default web browser set?"

Going to Setting as suggested by the first error above, selecting the your remote, clicking "Edit", then without changing anything, clicking OK to close that window, and then OK again to close the "repository settings" window, fixes the error and pull requests can be created again, but only temporarily, until Sourcetree is closed.

The next session of Sourcetree will still show the error when creating a pull request.

 

_Note_: This error happens in version *3.3.4*, not in version 3.2.4, but when creating the issue here and typing 3.3.4 in the "Affects Version/s" edit box, I get an error saying that that version doesn't exist.

 

There's a community question related to this:
https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Unable-to-Create-Pull-Request-Default-Browser-Empty/qaq-p/1213475
fields.summary: Error message when creating pull request (v3.3.4)

fields.description: Using system git version 2.24.0.windows.2 and SourceTree v3.2.6, I am stuck with popup dialog window indicating Git not found.
fields.summary: Git not found error

fields.description:
Registration-Dialog after upgrade of SourceTree does not proceed if a proxy is configured but not available. This can happen easily if you (normally) work behind a proxy but execute the upgrade in a network where the proxy is not available.

Currently you have to manually seach all SourceTree {{user.config}} files in the system and remove the proxy settings before the registration succeeds.

The log contains the following error:
{code:title=sourcetree.log}
ERROR [2019-11-06 12:18:03,081] [1] [SourceTree.UI.OnboardingManager] [Log] - Unable to submit Finished Registration Analytics
System.AggregateException: One or more errors occurred. ---> System.Net.Http.HttpRequestException: An error occurred while sending the request. ---> System.Net.WebException: The remote name could not be resolved: 'proxy.*****.org'
   at System.Net.HttpWebRequest.EndGetRequestStream(IAsyncResult asyncResult, TransportContext& context)
   at System.Net.Http.HttpClientHandler.GetRequestStreamCallback(IAsyncResult ar)
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at System.Net.Http.HttpClient.<FinishSendAsyncUnbuffered>d__59.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at Refit.RequestBuilderImplementation`1.<>c__DisplayClass13_0`1.<<BuildCancellableTaskFuncForMethod>b__0>d.MoveNext()
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
   at System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1.GetResultCore(Boolean waitCompletionNotification)
   at SourceTree.Mau.Submission.Gas.GasMauSubmissionService.Submit(GasEvent userActivityEvent)
   at SourceTree.Mau.Submission.Gas.GasMauSubmissionService.ForceSubmission()
   at SourceTree.Analytics.AnalyticsDataManager.ForceSubmission()
   at SourceTree.UI.OnboardingManager.SubmitFinishedRegistrationAnalytics(Boolean onboardingResult)
---> (Inner Exception #0) System.Net.Http.HttpRequestException: An error occurred while sending the request. ---> System.Net.WebException: The remote name could not be resolved: 'proxy.*****.org'
   at System.Net.HttpWebRequest.EndGetRequestStream(IAsyncResult asyncResult, TransportContext& context)
   at System.Net.Http.HttpClientHandler.GetRequestStreamCallback(IAsyncResult ar)
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at System.Net.Http.HttpClient.<FinishSendAsyncUnbuffered>d__59.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at Refit.RequestBuilderImplementation`1.<>c__DisplayClass13_0`1.<<BuildCancellableTaskFuncForMethod>b__0>d.MoveNext()<---
{code} 

 
This happened with Upgrade to 3.3.4 (cannot select correct affects version below).
fields.summary: Upgrade SourceTree not possible if proxy is configured but not available

fields.description: The just updated version 3.3.4 of Sourcetree may show warning while you tried to push a branch with / inside it (For ex. release/v3.06.0011) that was generated by Git-flow. You can't push but you can commit it and finish the branch successfully.
fields.summary: Couldn't push the Git-flow generated branches.

fields.description:
In Sourcetree 3.3.4, the sub-menu for Custom Actions has gone missing from the right-click (context) menu. Right-clicking on a modified file in the File Status view brings up the context menu as expected and the Custom Action items is present as expected, but the sub-menu with the individual custom actions is missing.

The sub-menu appears as expected when Custom Actions is chosen from the Actions pad on the main menu, just not when Custom Actions is chosen from the right-click menu.

Windows 10 Pro 64-bit.
fields.summary: Custom Actions sub-menu missing from context menu in Sourcetree 3.3.4

fields.description:
After updating to SourceTree 3.3.4 the "Remote" Icon shows an exlamation mark. Clicking on it show a message "Sie benötigen eine neue App zum öffnen von ssh".

The computer uses German language, SourceTree is set to English, so I would expect all error messages to be in English.

Unfortunately I cannot select the proper Version in "Affects Version/s" combo box - there is no 3.3.4 in there, even if I see it in "About Sourcetree".
fields.summary: Wrong translation

fields.description:
I finished a hotfix, but the merge was only completed to master and not to develop even though the "finish hotfix" window showed that the end result should have been merge to both.

Version: Windows, 3.2.6.
fields.summary: Finish hotfix didn't merge to develop

fields.description:
h3. Issue description
I've got co-workers working with different git tools. I work with Sourcetree.
Sourcetree, in this case, was unable to open a remote branch that has a pipe sign in the branch name.
{{feature/MXTS-15242|15245-before-dev-merge}}
The "Checkout" button will not enable and a small message in red text about an "invalid remote branch" appears.

h3. Expected behaviour
I'd expect Sourcetree to allow the pipe character in their branch names so Sourcetree can work with remote Git branches named in other Git software.

h3. Additional information
Working on 2017 Macbook Pro with macOS Catalina (version 10.15).
Source Tree version 3.2.1 (225) (can't select this one from "Affects Verion/s" in "create issue" wizard.
fields.summary: Not able to check out remote branch with pipe (vertical line) character

fields.description: can not select any brance when git push
fields.summary: can not select any branch when git push
can not select any brance when git submit

fields.description:
The lastest version of SourceTree suffers from huge rendering stalls which make it unusable. Attaching a mixed-mode debugger and breaking execution during a stall yields the following stack trace:

 

 

...
 WindowsCodecsExt.dll!CIcmColorTransform::Initialize() Unknown
 WindowsCodecsExt.dll!IWICColorTransform_Initialize_Proxy() Unknown
 PresentationCore.ni.dll!00007fffdce261fd() Unknown
 [Managed to Native Transition] 
 PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Imaging.ColorConvertedBitmap.FinalizeCreation() Unknown
 PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.CreateCachedBitmap(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame frame, System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSourceSafeMILHandle wicSource, System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions createOptions, System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption cacheOption, System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette palette) Unknown
 PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrameDecode.FinalizeCreation() Unknown
 PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.CompleteDelayedCreation() Unknown
 PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.WicSourceHandle.get() Unknown
 PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.DUCECompatiblePtr.get() Unknown
 PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.UpdateBitmapSourceResource(System.Windows.Media.Composition.DUCE.Channel channel, bool skipOnChannelCheck) Unknown
 PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.AddRefOnChannelCore(System.Windows.Media.Composition.DUCE.Channel channel) Unknown
 PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.System.Windows.Media.Composition.DUCE.IResource.AddRefOnChannel(System.Windows.Media.Composition.DUCE.Channel channel) Unknown
 PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.RenderData.System.Windows.Media.Composition.DUCE.IResource.AddRefOnChannel(System.Windows.Media.Composition.DUCE.Channel channel) Unknown
 PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.UIElement.RenderContent(System.Windows.Media.RenderContext ctx, bool isOnChannel) Unknown
 PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Visual.RenderRecursive(System.Windows.Media.RenderContext ctx) Unknown
 PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Visual.UpdateChildren(System.Windows.Media.RenderContext ctx, System.Windows.Media.Composition.DUCE.ResourceHandle handle) Unknown
 ...

 

 

The control being rendered is a `SourceTree.UI.Theme.Wpf.Controls.ThemeImage`, and the bitmap that is being rendered has the URI "pack://application:,,,/SourceTree.UI.Theme.Wpf;Component/Icons/FileStatus_Dark/modified.tiff".

I don't know anything about WPF and cannot tell if this is a WPF bug, but the call to `System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.CreateCachedBitmap()` happens many times for many UI operations in SourceTree, and every call costs ~1.2 sec which really adds up, especially because the UI thread is unresponsive during that time.
fields.summary: UI completely unusable due to delays in rendering code

fields.description:

OS: Windows Server 2012R2

  Locale ID: 1033
  Additional Information 1: 18ae

  Additional Information 3: ff72
  Additional Information 4: ff727757efb59f6881b3fc53aea5a7c6
fields.summary: Launching a second instance of Sourcetree crashes

fields.description:
I'm using the latest version of _source tree_: 3.2.6.

However, I can't do any git actions that interact with a remote because it fails with the following message:
{code:java}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks -c credential.helper= -c credential.helper="d:/Users/Etienne B-Pepin/AppData/Local/Atlassian/SourceTree/git_extras/git-credential-manager.exe" fetch --prune origin
d:/Users/Etienne B-Pepin/AppData/Local/Atlassian/SourceTree/git_extras/git-credential-manager.exe get: d:/Users/Etienne: No such file or directory
{code}
Considering that it outputs: {{d:/Users/Etienne: No such file or directory }}it seems to fail because there is a space in my user name.

I have already seen that this ticket flags the issue, but it doesn't seem to be fixed for me. https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-8801
fields.summary: Can't use sourcetree because of space in user name

fields.description: Verified that I can get to bitbucket.org on my own and my repository still exists. Remote icon has ! and when you click on it the correct url comes up, "[https://church8589@bitbucket.org/church8589/assignment_2/src/master/]" but it just spins and doesn't show anything. If I click to go to my profile it works. This is on 3.3.4, it asked me to upgrade and now it isn't working
fields.summary: Remote connection not working

fields.description:
!image-2019-10-31-10-43-14-748.png!

 

Any action that would send the user to a web browser doesn't work. (Example: Create Pull Request). Windows default is correctly set. No options in SourceTree were applicable.
fields.summary: Default Web Browser Not Recognized - Source Tree

fields.description: Hello Atlassian! My name's Lucas, and recently i've downloaded sourcetree to work with my university group to make a game. I can download the project to my PC, but i can't commit it back, because when I try to commit it, sourcetree just stop to work and then, it send me a mensage about a bug splat and then it closes. how can i fix it?
fields.summary: Bug Splat on commit

fields.description:
After Commit, the file that I want to Push disappears, and I have to use GIT to push the branch.   The Push button does not work without a file to push.

After I push the file using GIT, View>Refresh does not update the status of the file having been pushed.  I have to close SourceTree and reopen it to confirm the updated status.

Also, SourceTree is very slow, especially with Pull requests.

this is in version 3.2.6, not 3.2.2 which I entered in the "Affects Versions" drop down..  I entered 3.2.2 in the "Affects Versions" drop down because 3.2.6 was not an option
fields.summary: After commit, the file that I want to Push disappears

fields.description:
Please either undo the change "Added better copy/paste support for the log view" or at least make it optional. While I can understand that it might be useful if a user is using SourceTree exclusively, it is horribly inconvenient if one needs to use both SourceTree and any other tool (e.g. git shell): Where before the update I could simply copy the commit's hash to be used in other places (e.g. paste it into *git rebase -i <hash>* or anywhere else where the commit might be needed), now I have to delete a lot of garbage data to even get to that hash. Basically, this makes the whole "copy to clipboard" unusable for me, and as a result, SourceTree as well - there are many tasks where I need that commit ID easily available.

Note: Why can't I select version 3.3 in the bug report's "Affects version/s"?
fields.summary: "Copy from log view" in version 3.3

fields.description:
I am working with a number of different email addresses for the commits, for different repositories. Each time I clone a new repository, I have to enter the correct name and email address manually.

This is not only repetitive but also very dangerous. I have to carefully make sure to use the correct spelling.

Please implement an editable list of identities with name and email address pairs. Each time Sourcetree asks for the identity, let me select the correct from this list.
fields.summary: Add a Identity List to Quickly Choose the Name and Email Address for New or Cloned Repositories.

fields.description:
Sourcetree 4.0 comes with the following changes
{quote}*Changes*

*macOS Dark Mode*

Choose from automatic, light, or dark at a click

Replaces the previous custom Atlassian dark theme
{quote}
With all due respect, these two changes are broken.

Previous Atlassian dark theme was better in the sense of better colour contrast.

!image-2019-10-29-11-07-49-998.png|width=255,height=348!

In the attached screenshot you can see that the transparency of the sidebar doesn't play well with the number of commits ahead/behind.

 

Also, I cannot switch between Light/Dark theme. Now it's only Dark.

PS:" Sourcetree 4.0 - Major Release [22 October 2019]" is not part of the "Affects Version" list
fields.summary: Version 4.0 breaking Dark Mode switching

fields.description:
*Current Translation:*

"Pull master" => "Hole master"
"Fetch master" => "Holemaster"        Space is missing, same word for pull and fetch 

 

*Proposal:*
"Fetch master" => "Lade master"
fields.summary: German translation of "Pull" / "Fetch" is missleading

fields.description:
When I install and start the latest version of Sourcetree, the program crashes after the start. I have to install the old version again, otherwise Sourcetree is not usable for me. This problem has been with me for months. The last working version is 3.0.17. After the crash comes an error message with a report option. I use these. But unfortunately there is no improvement with the new updates.
The latest version I tried to install is 3.2.6. I have the latest version of Git installed. 2.23.0
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes after update

fields.description:
*This is happening on Windows version. Didn't check on Mac, etc.*

*+SourceTree v3.2.6+ release - downloaded from the website*

 
 # Checkout origin/master to local "master" branch
 # Checkout "fork/master" to "master-fork" branch (fork is forked from master)
 # Make change in the fork master, commit and push

SourceTree will create "master-fork" branch in origin, instead of pushing changes to fork/master repo.
fields.summary: Push to form is committing to master repository
